subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Originally probably a man ({{zh-l|*士}}) on a tower ({{zh-l|*高}}) from which he can shoot an arrow ({{zh-l|*至}}), hence meaning “[[watchtower]]”.

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text:
* Although use of the full traditional form {{lang|zh|臺}} is encouraged by the ROC Ministry of Education, the alternate form {{l|zh|台}} is also commonly used.<ref>{{Cite news |author=Shih Hsiu-chuan |title=Premier respects ‘choice’ on spelling |url=http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/taiwan/archives/2010/12/14/2003490913 |accessdate=8 Jan 2015|date=14 Dec 2010 |work=Taipei Times |page=3}}</ref>
* The surname <big>臺</big> (''[[tái]]'') is different from the surname {{zh-l|台*|[[yí]]}}. Note that {{zh-l|台*}} is the simplified form of <big>臺</big> in mainland China.
